Expenses related to the treatment of a Pre-Existing Disease (PED) and its direct complications are excluded until the expiry of thirty-six (36) months of continuous coverage after the date of inception of the first policy.

Yes, this policy covers maternity expenses, including medical treatment traceable to childbirth (complicated deliveries and caesarean sections during hospitalization) and lawful medical termination of pregnancy during the Policy Period, as well as pre-natal and post-natal hospitalization expenses and necessary vaccination for a New Born Baby. Conditions for coverage include the insured female being between eighteen and forty-five years of age, a twenty-four month waiting period (waivable for accident-induced events), a limit of two deliveries or terminations across the policy and its renewals, and only one delivery or termination per single Policy Period. Exclusions apply to maternity expenses for surrogate mothers (unless covered under infertility) and ectopic pregnancies. New Born Baby benefits require the female insured to have been continuously covered for at least 24 months, with automatic coverage for the baby up to three months of age, after which specific inclusion and premium payment are required.
The waiting period for cataract surgery is two years.

Yes, the medical expenses for an organ donor's hospitalization incurred for harvesting an organ donated to an Insured Person are covered under this policy. Coverage is subject to conditions, including adherence to the Transplantation of Human Organs Act 1994, the organ being for an Insured Person medically advised for transplant, and the expenses being incurred while the donor is an in-patient. Exclusions apply to items such as pre or post-hospitalization medical expenses of the donor, costs associated with organ acquisition, and medical treatment or complications to the donor consequent to harvesting.

For policies renewed with a one-year term, a flat 5% No Claim Discount (NCD) is applied to the base premium if no claims were reported in the expiring policy. For policies exceeding one year, the NCD from each claim-free year is aggregated, but the total aggregated NCD cannot exceed a flat 5% of the total base premium for the policy's entire term.

Yes, there is a benefit for preventive health check-ups. Expenses for health check-ups are reimbursed at the end of every two continuous policy years, provided the policy has been continuously renewed. The reimbursement amount is subject to limits specified in the Table of Benefits, ranging from INR 5,000 to INR 10,000.

A Hospital is defined as any institution established for in-patient care and day care treatment of disease/injuries that is either registered with local authorities under the Clinical Establishments (Registration and Regulation) Act, 2010, or complies with specific minimum criteria. These criteria include having qualified nursing staff and a medical practitioner(s) in charge round the clock, at least ten inpatient beds (fifteen in larger towns), a fully equipped operation theatre, and maintaining daily patient records accessible to the Company.

Medical expenses incurred for inpatient care treatment under Ayurveda, Yoga and Naturopathy, Unani, Siddha, and Homeopathy systems are indemnified up to the limit of the Sum Insured as specified in the Policy Schedule for each Policy Period, provided the treatment is received in an AYUSH Hospital.
